===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|水|alt1=氵|可|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

===Etymology===
Originally particularly used for the [[Yellow River]], with other rivers known as {{och-l|水}}. Later extended generally as a word for rivers in northern China but the influence of {{och-l|江|[[Yangtze]] [[river|River]]; [[river]] in [[southern]] [[China]]}} has meant that modern usage tends to favor it for shorter rivers and creeks except in historical cases.

External etymology uncertain. Various hypotheses have been proposed:
* Sino-Tibetan. Cognate with {{cog|bo|རྒལ||to cross, to traverse}} ({{zh-ref|Coblin, 1986}}).
* An Altaic loan. Compare {{cog|xgn-pro|*gowl||river}} > {{cog|mn|ᠭᠣᠣᠯ||river}} ({{zh-ref|Mei and Norman, 1976}}). This was argued against in {{zh-ref|Zhang (1998)}}.
* Derived from {{och-l|湖|lake}} ({{zh-ref|Matisoff, 1995}}).
